ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved in my IPA knowledge, specifically for French and German pronunciation. I also improved as a performer.

french diction
further mastery of german diction
acting skills
practice skills
Brief history of Brahms and Debussy, overview of German/French diction. Expanded my musical repertoire and developed rehearsal and performance techniques.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Fewer powerpoints and tongue twisters -- redundant
opportunity to learn more repertoire that is not performed. sight reading opportunities?

This course is really what you make it of it, it requires that you put in the time to practice outside of class time. This external practice is where most of the learning/improvement will happen, while the classes themselves are more geared towards performing/sharing with the other students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have experience and interest in art song, I highly recommend this course. I would talk to people who have taken it before to get more clarity about the requirements and expectations of this class. I generally had a good time and improved significantly.
No, because I selfishly want it to myself :3
YES!!! Professor Lalli is wonderful, and this was a great class. If you love singing take this class!!
Yes! As a singer, it's great to be introduced to new repertoire and add new music to your arsenal. Professor Lalli and Kohane provide great feedback to help you improve as a musician.
If you like classical singing, then absolutely yes!

extras.title: MUSI 337 01 - Songs of Brahms and Debussy
